intro: Cheiloclinium belizense, commonly known as the Belize hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain small, hairy seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
